UCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N. W.
Washington, D. C. 20036
Phone 667-6000 (Area Code 202)
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
Washington, D. C. , February 19 . . . William G. Harley, president of the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters, today praised President Johnson for
his ’’outstanding job of selecting a board of distinguished and public spirited
citizens to comprise the Board of Directors of the Corporation for Public Broad¬
casting. ” Announcement of the full board was made by President Johnson yesterday.
’’These people, each prestigious in his own right, provide a broad represen¬
tation of the various regions of the country, various professional and occupational
segments of our society and various areas of experience appropriate to the discharge
of this important responsibility, " Mr. Harley said.
The NAEB executive noted that he was particularly pleased with the selection
of Frank Pace, Jr. as Chairman. "Mr. Pace has a distinguished record of
achievement in. government and industry. He is at home in the meeting places of
Congressional committees as in the board rooms of corporations and he will bring
both broad experience and proven leadership ability to his demanding task. ”
Mr. Harley said he was additionally pleased that Frank Schooley, a pioneer
educational broadcaster and former president of the NAEB, was chosen as one
of the members of the board. "We commend the President for his choices and
extend congratulations and best wishes to the nominees, " Mr. Harley said.
